results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Walter Seltzer, Russell Thacher and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.

results.title: Southern comfort
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, EMI/Parlophone, Cinema Group, David Giler and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Louisiana 1973 - a squad from the Louisiana National Guard, together for a weekend reconnaissance exercise in the Louisiana Bayou, are about to experience the fight of their lives against an unexpected enemy. Eight men make up the squad and within this group exists a volatility which is about to tear them apart. Their own private unintentional war begins when they decide to steal three canoes from a Cajun campsite. This action results in unfortunate consequences when trigger-happy Private Stuckey fires blanks at some local Cajuns who have spotted them paddling off in the canoes. Retaliation and revenge follows and the battle for survival begins. Filmed in the Louisiana swamps, director Walter Hill (Crossroads, 48 Hours, Last man standing) has succeeded in creating an atmospheric environ which heightens the tension and adds to the ever-increasing state of paranoia. Surreal and disturbing, “Southern comfort” bears a similarity to “Deliverance” where the environment and the local people become the focus of the story. As in “Deliverance”, music too plays an important part and it is the brilliant Ry Cooder who has composed and arranged the music for this film with cinematography by Andrew Laszlo. Cast includes Keith Carradine, Powers Boothe, Fred Ward, Peter Coyote, Carlos Brown.

results.title: South Park: bigger, longer & uncut [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Paramount Pictures, Trey Parker and Matt Stone
results.brief_description: The boys from the American cult television program South Park launched onto the big screen in 1999 with their first feature length film ‘Bigger Longer and Uncut’, a cleverly written musical film looking at censorship and the influence film and television has on child development. Created by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, South Park follows the misadventures of friends Stan Marsh, Kyle Broflovski, Kenny McCormick and Eric Cartman in a small town called South Park in Colorado. Alien abductions, giant Barbra Streisand monsters and poor Kenny being killed episode after episode are just a few things the foul-mouthed boys have to deal with. When the boys see an R film starring Canadian icons ‘Terrance and Philip’, their parents become distressed at the language the boys are using. Rather than take responsibility for not supervising their children, the parents choose to blame Canada, and arrest Terrance and Philip, causing an USA v Canada war. With Terrance and Philip’s lives at stake, the boys create an underground children’s resistance, aptly named ‘La Resistance’ to free their Canadian idols before they are executed. The films subplot explores relationships, including Stan’s unusual relationship with classmate Wendy Testeburger, and her new found affection for a boy who is ‘political’. South Park character favourites Mr Garrison, Mr Mackey, Chef and Officer Barbrady also make appearance, as does Saddam Hussein, Satan and Winona Ryder. Parker and Stone’s clever soundtrack, spoofing a number of popular musicals including ‘Les Miserables’ and ‘The Sound of Music’ in addition to their own musical creations, earned them an Oscar nomination for Best Song (“Blame Canada’) in 2000. Features the voices of Isaac Hayes, Minnie Driver, Eric Idle and George Clooney. Warning: CONTAINS COARSE LANGUAGE.

results.title: South Pacific (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Magna Corporation, S P Enterprises, Buddy Adler and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: Tender romance, an immortal score and enchanted South Seas splendour are set against the dark backdrop of a world war, in this lush and passionate musical classic. The score is as breathtaking as the South Seas setting - “Some enchanted evening”, “Bali Hai”, “There is nothing like a dame”, “Younger than springtime”, and many more. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize, “South Pacific” ranks among the most celebrated of Rodgers and Hammerstein’s acclaimed musical masterpieces. Stars Mitzi Gaynor, Rossano Brazzi, John Kerr, Ray Walston, France Nuyen and Juanita Hall as Bloody Mary.

display_values: Feature films → Feature films - United States

results.title: Sophie's choice
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, Alan Pakula and Keith Barish
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by William Styron, this is a remarkably faithful adaptation of the original best-seller. Meryl Streep gives a glorious performance as Sophie Zawistowska, the tragic Polish Catholic beauty, who having survived Auschwitz, has settled in America after World War II. The time is 1947. Stingo (Peter MacNicol), a 22 year-old aspiring writer from rural Virginia, rents a room in a Brooklyn boarding house. He is drawn to his exotic upstairs neighbours, Sophie and Nathan (Kevin Kline), a madly romantic couple whose instability and flamboyance utterly capture this young man’s imagination. The deeper he delves into these people’s lives, the more he learns that each harbours terrible and terrifying secrets. This personalised view of the Holocaust and its devastating effect on one woman who survived it, is a shattering, moving experience.

results.title: Song of the road = Pather panchali
results.creator_credit: Government of West Bengal and Satyajit Ray
results.brief_description: Adapted from the novel of the same name by Bibhutibhusan Banerji, this is the first part of Satyajit Ray’s renowned trilogy of films about Apu, the son of a would-be writer in a small Bengal village, who grows up in poverty before setting off with what remains of his family to seek a living in Benares. It shows Apu as a young boy experiencing his first taste of the delights and tragedies of life. The film is universally regarded as a great work of poetic cinema. Music provided by Ravi Shankar. Bengali dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Sommersby
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal+, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Arnon Milchan and Jon Amiel
results.brief_description: People remembered Jack Sommersby as a bitter, loutish man but when he returns home after the Civil War, he’s tender, caring and resourceful. Has the war changed him… or is the man calling himself Jack Sommersby an impostor? Richard Gere and Jodie Foster are a match for the ages in Sommersby, a period romance rich in mystery, detail and splendid performances. They portray Jack and Laurel Sommersby, whose love grows as the suspicions about Jack mount. If he isn’t the man she married, Laurel knows he is the man she always wanted, but an ultimate test of their love and Jack’s identity awaits. Jack must stand trial for his life and the outcome makes for a memorable film.

results.title: Somewhere in time
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Stephen Deutsch and Jeannot Szwarc
results.brief_description: A man is given an antique gold watch from an old woman who pleads with him to travel back in time with her. Years later, the man, Richard, is overwhelmed by a photograph of a beautiful woman. Seeing a picture of the woman in her later years, Richard realises that she is the same woman who gave him the watch, and that they had an affair the time the photo was taken. He becomes obsessed with returning to 1912 and being reunited with the young woman and is willing to sacrifice his life in the present to find happiness in the past. Cast includes Christopher Reeve, Jane Seymour, Christopher Plummer and Teresa Wright. Based on the novel “Bid time return” by Richard Matheson.

results.title: Something wild
results.creator_credit: Primitiva Religiosa, Jonathan Demme and Kenneth Utt
results.brief_description: Uptight tax consultant Charlie (Jeff Daniels) is picked up by eccentric, free-thinker Lulu (Melanie Griffith). Although he’s not entirely certain how he’s going to explain his sudden disappearance to his wife and his boss, he accompanies her on an impulsive journey to the farthest reaches of New Jersey. Lulu introduces Charlie as her husband to her friends and relatives attending a high school reunion. The couple is held hostage by holdup man Ray (Ray Liotta) who happens to be Lulu’s ex. When Ray makes it clear that he wants Lulu back, that’s when the real trouble begins. Cameos by John Sayles, John Waters and Charles Napier. Includes music scores by David Byrne, Laurie Anderson, John Cale.
